Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.redis.codec

Class RESPDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.redis.codec.RESPDecoder
  • public class RESPDecoder
extends java.lang.Object
    Decodes RESP wire format to values.

    This decoder handles streaming input, accumulating data until complete RESP values can be parsed. It is designed for use with non-blocking I/O where data arrives in arbitrary chunks.

    Usage Pattern

    
 RESPDecoder decoder = new RESPDecoder();

 // In receive callback:
 decoder.receive(buffer);

 RESPValue value;
 while ((value = decoder.next()) != null) {
     // Process complete value
     if (value.isError()) {
         handleError(value.getErrorMessage());
     } else {
         handleReply(value);
     }
 }

    The decoder maintains internal state between calls, so partial values are preserved across multiple receive() calls.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Method Detail

      • receive

        public void receive​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Receives data for decoding.

        The data is appended to any existing buffered data. Call next() to retrieve decoded values.

        Parameters:
        data - the data to decode

      • next

        public RESPValue next()
               throws RESPException
        Attempts to decode the next complete RESP value.

        If a complete value is available, it is returned and removed from the buffer. If the data is incomplete, returns null and the data is preserved for the next call.

        Returns:
        the next decoded value, or null if incomplete
        Throws:
        RESPException - if the data is malformed

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the decoder, discarding any buffered data.

      • bufferedBytes

        public int bufferedBytes()
        Returns the number of bytes currently buffered.
        Returns:
        the buffered byte count
